title: Growing Together Physically
description: Explore how your physical connection develops over time

questions.text: I feel like we're learning about each other physically over time.

therapeutic.rationale: A learning orientation toward physical connection keeps it growing. When partners stop learning about each other, intimacy can stagnate.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If learning has stopped for one partner, explore what would revive curiosity. New experiences? More communication? Different approach?
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual sense of ongoing learning creates a growing physical connection.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What are you still learning about your partner physically?

questions.text: Our physical connection has room to evolve and change.

therapeutic.rationale: Room for evolution means not being stuck in fixed patterns. Physical connection that can change adapts to different life stages and circumstances.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't feel room for evolution, explore what feels stuck. Is it about openness? Communication? Willingness to try new things?
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared sense of room to evolve creates adaptability in your physical connection.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How has your physical connection changed? How might it continue to evolve?

questions.text: I feel we're getting better at physical connection over time.

therapeutic.rationale: Perceiving improvement motivates continued investment. When physical connection feels stagnant or declining, discouragement can set in.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: Different perceptions of improvement warrant discussion. One partner may see growth the other doesn't, or they may have different standards.
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared sense of improvement creates optimism about your physical future.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: In what ways has your physical connection improved? Where would you like more growth?

questions.text: I sense openness to exploring and growing in how we connect physically.

therapeutic.rationale: Openness to exploration keeps physical connection alive and growing. Rigidity or refusal to grow can leave partners feeling stuck.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't sense openness, explore what creates that perception. The other partner may be open but not showing it, or may have fears.
therapeutic.whenSame: Mutual openness to exploration enables continued growth.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: How open does your partner seem to exploring and growing physically?

questions.text: I look forward to how our physical connection might deepen.

therapeutic.rationale: Anticipation about future deepening reflects hope and investment. Dreading or feeling indifferent about physical future signals disconnection.
therapeutic.whenDifferent: If one partner doesn't look forward to deepening, explore what's behind that. Exhaustion? Disconnection? Fear?
therapeutic.whenSame: Shared anticipation for deepening creates hope and motivation.
therapeutic.journalPrompt: What do you hope for in your physical connection going forward?
